website_summaries.verdict: Flying with larger animals is challenging; fortunately, this durable carrier provides both plenty of room and ventilation to take the worry out of air travel.
pros: Respected brand in airline-approved pet transport
Easy to assemble and includes holes that can be tied together for extra security
Provides space enough for dogs to turn around
Buyers report that dogs who chew through wire crates can't typically chew through this hard plastic one
cons: Carrier has ventilation openings on 3 sides, and some airlines require ventilation on all 4 sides
May have to drill extra holes before flying

customer_reviews.title: Not a Petmate Kennel
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for an international flight thinking it was a Petmate Pet Porter. This AspenPet Pet Porter does not have the rear ventilation needed for international travel. I should have looked at the listing a little closer. (Photo shows 36” Petmate kennel, 32” AspenPet, 28” Petmate)
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Clarke

customer_reviews.title: Not safe!!!!
customer_reviews.text: My less than 30 lb mixed breed mutt ate through the plastic and escaped on its 2nd time in this crate. Plastic is not thick. I do not see how this could be considered safe for airlines. I bought because it was recommended by Amazon. Waste of $80. Let's hope the dog did not ingest the plastic.I believe Amazon should refund my money for recommending this product!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: NOT GOOD AT ALL!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Horrible!!! SUCH FALSE ADVERTISEMENT! This carrier is so cheap and flimsy I appalled that a company can feel good about selling this for live animals. I wouldnt even feel safe putting a hammer in it let alone my kitten. Just arrived today and as I started to take the bottom piece to connect to the top...it was so thin and flimsy and cheap...i didnt even bother. I cant believe that so many people actually bought this case and wrote good reviews. People should be ashamed of themselves to sell such a cheap product! I'd give no stars if I could.
customer_reviews.author: Jeepet76

customer_reviews.title: Inferior product caused loss of animal,  very angry
customer_reviews.text: My daughter used this was brand new it has never been used before well it fell apart my daughter lost her cat and we have never found it this was last year I would never suggest anybody buy one of these I just now found the link to find it again because I was going to report this last year but I could not find the link until today I’m very upset that my daughter lost her cat also the door fell off my daughter was so upset that she lost the cat that she didn’t even think about trying to find the door
customer_reviews.author: Lonewolf

customer_reviews.title: Bloody mess
customer_reviews.text: This carrier is not very good quality. I just went to Walmart and the carriers there were cheaper and better in quality. There are jagged edges all over the carrier, one of which my mom cut her finger on.
customer_reviews.author: sew happy!

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy. Well Made
customer_reviews.text: works great for my 5 month old boxer to grow into. I ordered this because of the color. I wanted something of quality that wasn't tacky like most of the others. It fits perfectly in a standard size SUV. Just travelled from TLH to ATL in a Jeep Grand Cherokee and folded the bavk seat down so my pup could face the front to see me and feel safe. Its made very well, its sturdy and easy to transport. Exactly as described. Very happy
customer_reviews.author: ErinMarie

customer_reviews.title: VERY LARGE KENNEL
customer_reviews.text: It is very sturdy and VERY LARGE. I mistakenly ordered the largest one thinking it would be the next size bigger than the one I already have. But this one was extremely large and too large for my needs. It is so large and heavy that I didn't know how to return it. I cannot use it due to the space it takes up. Would like to be able to return it - or sell it. It would be great for a Great Dane or and Irish Wolfhound or similarly large dog -- could use it for other animals too.
customer_reviews.author: Vikki Bang

customer_reviews.title: Door latch is practically impossible to work!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this kennel, put it together, and all went well, until I tried to work the door latch, and tried and tried. It was somehow rubbing inside the mechanism, causing one of the two spring loaded levers to rub so badly it was almost impossible to move. These are the two levers necessary to insert and release the pins in the holes on one side of the door to hold the door closed. I returned the kennel (free shipping, thank you Amazon), but when I received my replacement, the door latch was exactly the same - impossible to move. I don't know what I'll do, but one thing for sure, I would never buy this product again.
customer_reviews.author: Patti Winker

customer_reviews.title: Overall good value, but pics can be a bit misleading and a few improvements would make it better
customer_reviews.text: Crate arrived well packaged and was fairly easy to put together. However, the top handle was missing, and unlike the images when I purchased mine, there are no air vents on the top back panel at all. I had to have a relative to drill some holes in the back to allow the air to circulate in our southern summer heat. The squeeze and release door closure is pretty standard, but didn't always operate smoothly and is difficult for owners who lack strength in their hands and/or good fine motor skills. Otherwise, however, it was a good value and held up well to my rapidly growing GSD.
customer_reviews.author: PrivateShopper

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous! Door pops off
customer_reviews.text: This crate is dangerous! In the video I uploaded, you can see I have the door properly fitted, yet with a very small amount of pressure, the door pops completely out. If you were to lift this with a cat inside, the weight of the cat and the upwards pulling would cause the door to come off as I have shown. Also the side plastic is just as thin; gentle pressure and the whole side bends. I would NEVER put any animal in here, as they will not be safe or secure. I will be returning this.
customer_reviews.author: lilpinkbunny

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy
customer_reviews.text: The product is kind of cheaply made and flimsy. Not like the two other cat carriers I have. Guess I need to buy from an actual store where I can feel the product. The carrier flexes too much I think when carried by the handle. And the cat is well within the weight limits. It will do in a pinch, but not one I would use regularly as it doesn't appear to be too safe or sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Rlincoln

customer_reviews.title: My dog ripped right through this.
customer_reviews.text: I have a swiss white shepherd and he ripped right through the metal door with ease. The create just couldn't hack it. I guess if you had a dog that wasn't such a pain in the rear the cage would hold up better. I'm thinking about just building a box out of plywood and poking some holes through it (I'm just kidding. I will not be doing this). I did find a much heavier thicker gaged metal crate that seems to be doing the job; but for how long....
customer_reviews.author: EOC

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as I thought it was going to be
customer_reviews.text: We bought this kennel for our Boxer but was very disappointed when we came home and she was running the house. The cage door is easy to open when hit against. Now mind you our Boxer has been kennel trained for a while now. We called the company and there was know help there at all and was told we just need to train our dog better. So what we had to do was drill through the front the lip around the door and put a doll through it and that now is working. It was also broke when we got it and again we got know help from the company. Would not buy another one.
customer_reviews.author: Pam

customer_reviews.title: Quality control is going down.
customer_reviews.text: I have to say the reviews were correct this is a very flimsy cheaply made crate. It does the job for me as I use it for my 19 lb Westie who doesn’t destroy things on long road trips. My old one was 11 years old thought it was time for a new one. The older one was made better but the clips started to go and the old one has a seat belt loop which this one does not have but overall it does the trick. I just have to use a doggie strap thats attached to the headrest and hooks on the handle of the crate. It’s works well but I wish it was built a little better.
customer_reviews.author: tripps

customer_reviews.title: Not all that great
customer_reviews.text: Not a quality carrier by no means. The material is not of heavy duty plastic and is very flexible. The upper and lower halves are held together with clips. The instructions to assemble the carrier are located between the two halves that arrive pressed together. This will work to transport my cat once or twice a year to the vet. It is not nearly as sturdy as our dog carrier purchased at the local pet store. Shop around locally and get a better carrier for your money.
customer_reviews.author: Old Navy

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and good size for medium/large dog
customer_reviews.text: So far, this crate has lasted and is working good for my medium/large dog that is half pitbull half boxer. She can stand up fully in the crate which is good because most crates are a little too small for her to stand up fully in. It is strong and durable too.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica H

customer_reviews.title: This was the worst product I ever bought
customer_reviews.text: This was the worst product I ever bought. Nothing fit and I had to struggle. There were screws and the holes were sealed not even open for the crews. There was a piece in the back that I had to cut off to make everything fit. I will never trust this cheaply made carrier. I am so disappointed and don't recommend it for anyone who is looking for something to transport their pets. I feel ripped off.
customer_reviews.author: Jude Patch Guglielmino

customer_reviews.title: Not as secure as I would like but still a good value
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to transport our medium size cat to the vet. I like that our cat can turn around and love the color and how easy it was to put together. HOWEVER, the clips that hold the front together are not quite as secure as I expected. Our cat was able to push hard enough to pop the door out of the plastic casing. Thankfully we were in the house so she didn't get loose in a dangerous place but it is a concern for future use. I checked to ensure I assembled it correctly but I will definitely see if it can be reinforced before future use.
customer_reviews.author: KGS

customer_reviews.title: Worth the Money
customer_reviews.text: I have a tall 82 LB Labrador whose wire crate was 30 years old and rusting. I felt the more expensive travel crates did not have the width I was looking for and I liked the dimensions of this crate. I ordered the 70-90lb size and pup fits very well in it. It was very easy to put together and perfect for the back of my truck bed with cap. I'm not sure it would qualify for air travel and a chewer would enjoy attacking the vent holes but my pup is a good traveler and I thought this was well worth the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Trish

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware of Used Prime warehouse
customer_reviews.text: It was exactly as it claimed missing a few bolts. That i can understand. What i can't get over is it shipped from Amazon warehouse via Prime so i was expecting a new kennel with some missing bolts. What i got was a wet urinated on the inside and sticky dried urine droplets on the outside obviously made by a male dog, stinking reeking kennel that had dog hair stuck to label on the inside. Some one used this kennel, likely to fly their dog then returned it! GROSS!
customer_reviews.author: Hans Weim

customer_reviews.title: Not bad for a lazy cat...not great for an active one
customer_reviews.text: I have several outdoor cats, and I was needing to take them out of town to be spayed/neutered at a clinic. These carriers work fine for your average sized, lazy cat. Not so much if it's an athletic cat that hates to be crated. I ended up using duct tape around the entire crate to make sure the cats didn't bust right through that rather flimsy plastic. I have some cats that are under 8lbs and some pushing 20lbs. You don't want to put a cat in here that's over 12lbs. And be sure to reinforce it. Otherwise, it's fine for an average, lazy cat.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer S.

customer_reviews.title: Will work in a pinch. Not very durable construction.
customer_reviews.text: The plastic is thin and I don't think you could lift a large dog with the built in handle. You will have to lift from the bottom. If you have to travel on the airlines with this case it may not hold up. I only use this to get the dog to the vet or groomers but this isn't ideal for airline or long vehicle travel. You might fair well with this if you have an SUV or large interior cargo area but this won't fair well in the back of a pickup even if you secure it down.
customer_reviews.author: Cbert

customer_reviews.title: The title is a lie, not heavy duty at all
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 7 pound puppy. He had outgrew his other crate and this one actually is the perfect size, but it is just straight-up junk. I figured that since it was from Amazon and said "heavy-duty" that it would be pretty sturdy. Not at all. The bottom piece of it was decent, but the top section bent like crazy when I put my dog in it and picked it up by the handle. I'm returning it immediately, but I can't imagine this would last more than a week if I actually kept on using it.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew James

customer_reviews.title: perfect for my cat
customer_reviews.text: works great for my cat. I like the color pattern and how easy it was to assemble. My cat still hates car rides though but at least she'll be safe and as comfortable as she can be. I would buy it again. When she isn't going for a car ride she likes to go inside and take naps. It seems to be durable and sturdy but time will tell but so far it's holding up great. My only wish is that it has an actual slot for a seatbelt to go through instead of having to slide it in the carrying handle.
customer_reviews.author: branden boling

customer_reviews.title: Whippet loves his den
customer_reviews.text: We love this crate for our Whippet. He could be lounging on the couch right now, but somehow prefers to lounge in his little den. Maybe it's cooler in there. Maybe he feels safe in there. Either way, it's perfect for him. Also, I like the gray color of the crate. It works with our gray walls better than other crate colors. We also transport him in this crate on road trips. He's only thrown up once and it was much easier to clean up than if he had thrown up in the car!
customer_reviews.author: Nic McTop Contributor: Pokémon

customer_reviews.title: Great economy option for small cat
customer_reviews.text: Great carry case for a light cat! I used this with a cat under 6 pounds and it worked beautifully for a very long car ride. My cat is a petite diluted calico female. I would not be comfortable using it for my 10 pound Russian blue though because it doesn’t seem like it would be sturdy enough for his larger and taller frame.
customer_reviews.author: Doodles17

customer_reviews.title: Very secure
customer_reviews.text: This crate is huge. Our 70 lb puppy has a lot of room to grow. It is solidly build and the locking device is very secure and easy to use with one hand. I will say though that if you need this to be portable you might look for a smaller one. Once it was together in our room we would have to take it apart to take back out. Would not fit through standard doors.
customer_reviews.author: Lynda Marroletti

customer_reviews.title: Not great quality
customer_reviews.text: Front clip broke off when trying to assemble it. Lots of raggedy plastic ends. If you're looking for quality you should look elsewhere. If you just need a cheap kennel to rarely use outside of transporting your pet to vet appointments then this will do the trick. Not going to return it even though the clip broke. It is one of the small ones that doesn't appear to do much. It comes with bolts that hold the top and bottom together anyway... So I think the front clips are just there for looks and nothing more.
customer_reviews.author: Thisismypublicname

customer_reviews.title: Double check and ask
customer_reviews.text: The first one I got is perfect. It matches the description of the product. I decided to order another for my other dog. Received in timely manner like the other one, easy to assemble like the other. However, this crate is smaller than the first crate. The height and width are off. It's tight even for my shorter dog to fit and be able to turn around.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Mau

customer_reviews.title: DEFECTIVE, fragile handle. Broke in <2 months with 20 lb pup
customer_reviews.text: DEFECTIVE. It's supposed to hold up to 25 lbs., thus it is a defective product since it broke in less than 2 months for a 20 lb. Vizsla puppy. While I was holding the crate by its handle, the plastic that secured the handle broke and the crate fell onto the floor violently with my puppy inside. Thankfully, the pup didn't have physical injuries, but he may have been somewhat traumatized about the experience.
customer_reviews.author: iamgrace

customer_reviews.title: The BEST Kennel for a Giant
customer_reviews.text: I have a Service Dog that is a Cane Corso. He's still only one, and at 80 pounds. this crate fits him VERY well, and is CERTAINLY sturdy enough to do a great job. He has room to turn around, but is contained enough to feel that he's safe in his "den". This crate could only be better if the door latching rods fit better into their holes in the top and bottom of the kennel. it's not perfect, but it is VERY, VERY good.
customer_reviews.author: MUAATHA B AMATUL-HAQQ

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking, roomy kennel. Great delivery.
customer_reviews.text: The crate is a nice dark grey with a slight texture which gives it an architectural sort of look. I mean, for a giant plastic dog box. My dog is afraid of crates so we have't really used it yet--acclimating will be a process--but I have zero complaints about the look of the kennel or the ease of assembly. Further, I got to select my delivery date and time. They were 30 minutes early and called to give me word they were 15 minutes away. They delivered the box right inside my foyer so I didn't have to go outside in the cold to get it.
customer_reviews.author: chaskagirl

customer_reviews.title: Wrong brand sent. Crate has a considerable amount of scratches.
customer_reviews.text: This crate was this originally labeled as a "Petmate" crate, and I was sent an Aspen Pet pet porter. I wouldn't have ordered this unknown brand. The top of the crate is thoroughly scratched up. Very disappointed. This crate was purchased to travel to dog shows and even hold client dogs. With the physical damage, and what seems to be inferior plastic and door, I won't be using this.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Defective, had to return; apparently returned before
customer_reviews.text: When I opened the shipping box, it was apparent that this item had been returned before because the hardware was loose and falling out all over the place. When I tried to put the carrier together I quickly saw why it was returned. The door latches wouldn't line up with the frame holes. I tried assembling it with the door opening from the right and again opening from the left, and had the same problem with alignment either way. Other than that, the kennel seemed pretty sturdy, but I returned it for a refund rather than an exchange because I'm afraid of getting another defective one.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Esch

customer_reviews.title: Afraid it will drop your cat?
customer_reviews.text: I bought this even though several reviewers said material is flimsy and screws/nuts system didn't fit part of the time. I was desperate for carrier this size for my senior cat. All of the above was true, so after taking her in it twice, I went to Home Depot, bought a package of 4 Everbilt metal wing nuts size #10-24 and a package of 5 Everbilt machine screws round head combo #10-24 x 1-1/2 inch. Zinc plated. Just finished taking originals out and replacing with these which fit perfectly and can be tightened down. Less than $3.50 fix. Dawn
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: I was very disappointed with the quality of the kennel
customer_reviews.text: I was very disappointed with the quality of the kennel. The plastic has several deformed spots, some of which are very sharp. Had I purchased this for a dog or cat, I would have absolutely had to return it. The only reason I'm not returning it is because I purchased it for my guinea pigs visits to the veterinarian and I won't have time to return it and order another one before their next appointment. I read the reviews before I purchased it so maybe I just got a defective one. It also had sticky stuff all over the outside but it cleaned easily enough.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria E.

customer_reviews.title: Basic
customer_reviews.text: It's designed for what it's intended todo.. no hassle, no shortage of screws/caps - In fact, you get afew extras added incase the plastic cap gets stripped after cleansing inside. When I looked at product before purchase I didn't think it had a door on top and it does which is easy for me and the vet to care after my mid-Adult Cat that loves being in it and wants to sleep in it after her visit.
customer_reviews.author: Eddie

customer_reviews.title: Great kennel!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect and durable kennel. Works great for our German Shepard!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good pet porter,  Size not as discribed
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good pet porter. Strong, sturdy. and easy to use. I have four labs, 2 sleep together in one porter. My only complaint is the sizes given are not the interior size. The interior size at the largest points are as follows: 44" long, 29" wide, 32" high. I called and talked to the manufacture of the product. They told me that their measurements are from the out side edges including the wrap around. Depending on the size of your pet, you may want to order the larger size.
customer_reviews.author: Dogman

customer_reviews.title: Great product but really small dog.
customer_reviews.text: So this cage is a Great product but really small.is for a very small dog. I purchased a eight weeks old Yorky and the cage is the appropriate size for that size dog. Once my Yorky started to grow, there was limited movement that she could make in the cage. I would recommend if you already have a full-grown small dog to purchase a bigger size. Don’t get me wrong I like the cage I just think that it’s not for a really small dog It’s for a small dogs puppy.
customer_reviews.author: JUSTME

customer_reviews.title: Good price for pet carrier for vet visits
customer_reviews.text: Not quite the same quality as the previous carrier (same size/brand) we purchased - the plastic is a little thinner. We do like the added safety screws on the corners. For those who commented that the carrier comes apart - we use zip ties through the opening on every side clip - no chance of them coming apart. We have always done this with the side clip pet carriers for extra safety.
customer_reviews.author: M. L. Arnold

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, easy to clean and well constructed.
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our new Goldendoodle puppy. She is now 5 months old, and weighs 25 pounds. She uses the kennel each night and it fits her very well. We know she will grow, but there is plenty of room. The kennel is easy to clean, sturdy, and provides a very comfortable, safe, and cozy place for our dog. The kennel/pet carrier will easily fit in the back of our Honda CRV, so that we can take it with us when we go visit out daughter.
customer_reviews.author: Vicky B. Van Straten

customer_reviews.title: This carrier is great!
customer_reviews.text: This carrier was actually a little roomier than I expected, but perfect! I was able to fit a nice blanket inside for my kitties and they were actually wrestling over who got to ride in this carrier. The snap locks are great, there were added bolts to secure the four corners if needed. And it’s super easy to assemble, it took less than 5 mins. Will be purchasing again, as my kitties are obsessed with this one. Definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: KS

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply Made and Unusable
customer_reviews.text: This crate is so cheaply made that it's unusable! The plastic is so thin and fragile the clips that hold the bottom and top won't even hold. Also, the screws that are suppose to help hold the top and bottom together are too long so you can't tighten them enough to hold it together. I wouldn't trust this crate to hold a stuffed animal let alone my cat! Will be returning for sure!
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: Worked great until my dog chewed through it lol. He doesn't like the door closed but it still works. It just doesn't look pretty anymore. So instead I have a 5 ft tie-down that I anchored to the foot of my dresser and it's long enough for him to go in and out of the kennel. Eventually I want him to learn that it's his safe space as he was previously a 100% outdoor dog before we rescued him. My other dog loves running into it! My dog is a sharpei mastiff mix, approximately 90 pounds, and the size is perfect for him.
customer_reviews.author: K. Moore

customer_reviews.title: Poor packaging and poor quality plastic
customer_reviews.text: Item was horribly cracked straight out of the box. Poor packaging and poor quality plastic. Update, I returned product 3 months ago and im still for a replacement still. Horrible. Wish I could give it 0 stars. Don’t waste your money
customer_reviews.author: Ted Lubbers

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I love how easy it was to put together and my dog Paisley loves it!!
customer_reviews.author: Juetta

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and false labeling
customer_reviews.text: Firstly, the brand on this is listed as petmate. That is not what this is. This is Aspenpet. I spent an amount of money that was reasonable for petmate, not for the cheap product I got. The plastic of these carriers is cheap. Fortunately, the cats I got them for are very small. The hardware is also cheap. They are clearly designed to mimic petmate products, complete with logo markings, but with flimsier materials. These are not suitable for air travel. They also do not have the seatbelt clips that petmate carriers have, so they're also not great for car travel. Don't buy this.
customer_reviews.author: Sophie H

customer_reviews.title: Solved my problem!
customer_reviews.text: One of my cats had a real problem being put in a small carrier. I mean, she became a hissing screaming demon that fought like a panther.. Scary!!! This larger carrier has proved easy to put her in. She still doesn't like it, but just caterwauls sadly now, anytime I take her to the vet. I think the claustrophobia of the smaller carrier really bothered her. Solved my problem.
customer_reviews.author: the Shrike

customer_reviews.title: My Girl Loves It
customer_reviews.text: So my cat loves her crate. I put a crate liner cushion in it and on cold nights so curls up in it quite happily - I even had to remove the door so she could access it at all times without having to bug me to open it! Luckily it’s easy to remove and replace the door! Plus it’s pink for my little Cirilla and sturdy, that’s always nice!
customer_reviews.author: Niki Gray

customer_reviews.title: Okay for Docile Dogs
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble. Not a great choice if you have an escape artist dog. Springs for the door lock are not great. Probably fine if you have a very docile dog who just lays down. The only problem is for the locking mechanism for the door, but again if your dog is good with being crated, probably not an issue. Used with 4 year old boxer / escape artist.
customer_reviews.author: JackofallTrades

customer_reviews.title: Came A Lot Sooner Than They Said/Satisfied
customer_reviews.text: This is a good product; easy to put together. It was missing some drill holes & screws & nuts, but what it had was good enough to hold together well. The bottom edge sits flush with floor, but under the bottom middle section it has 2 small raised circles to hold up the whole center of cage. I feel like it will end up bowing on bottom. I bought for a Husky to be able to stretch out in. I think a St. Bernard or Great Dane would fit in there easily b/c 2 of my Huskies can fit inside curled up.
customer_reviews.author: D. Patterson

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive and fairly cheaply made as well
customer_reviews.text: The color was as pictured and the small size will work nicely for my cats. There are some extra pieces of sharp plastic that seem to have been missed during the inspections and will need to be filed off. In addition, mine was missing the top lids for the compartments. I had to email the company for those and we will see if they send me back to Amazon. Of course Amazon directed me to their website.
customer_reviews.author: Renee S.

customer_reviews.title: great, affordable, solid crate
customer_reviews.text: This is a solid crate. Unless you have a really serious chewer, this will hold your pup just fine. And my dog chews everything. But there's nothing really to grab onto. I'm sure a sever chewer would figure out an angle, but mine sure hasn't. $49 bucks, super easy to assemble, sized right. My pup slept well in here. Also packaged well and arrived quickly. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: babs em

customer_reviews.title: Really wanted to love it!
customer_reviews.text: Love the color buy dislike most everything else. Very cheaply made. The four corner screws don't screw on all the way. The plastic latches feel very temperamental but as a plus you can add zipties. Most troubling is the carry handle at the top of the box, its unsupported. The lack of support makes breaking the handle off only a matter of time.
customer_reviews.author: Zachary

customer_reviews.title: One Latch Doesn't Work
customer_reviews.text: The rear latch on the crate I got doesn't work well at all (it's hard to get it to latch, and then it pops open on its own). For me, it's not a big deal since I use Duct tape to keep the shell halves together just in case (I use this for raccoons, among other things), but if you rely solely on the latches, I'd worry about them.
customer_reviews.author: David Wood

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy, cute and perfect for small dogs. Roomy inside and I ordered the soft pad to go along with it and am very satisfied with the set! Good quality and my Chihuahua Tinker loves it! The snaps on the side and bolt screws add the extra tight support to keep it closed safely as well as easy to break it down for storage. There are tiny trays on top for storage.
customer_reviews.author: Danny Oldham

customer_reviews.title: Not Escape Proof
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my one-year-old 75lb German Shepherd who has pretty bad separation anxiety. I thought being in more of an enclosed crate may make him feel more secure than he was feeling in a wire crate with open sides. I put him in there for the first time and was gone for a few hours. When I got home, he greeted me at the door. He had busted open the door of the crate down to escape. The bars on the door easily bent. While the plastic portion of this crate is pretty sturdy, the door is very flimsy. This crate is NOT for a dog that’s an escape risk.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: arrived broken
customer_reviews.text: It arrived broken. How would someone call this heavy duty or plan to travel with something that broke while wrapped in bubble wrap!? Also, Amazon warehouse, used very good listed repackaged, NOT any mention of damage. Now I need to wait ANOTHER week for the replacement and lug this beast of a broken kennel to UPS. Total pain.
customer_reviews.author: C. Snyder

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy and cheap!
customer_reviews.text: Ordered two to transport my fur babies on an airline trip to their new home. When they arrived, I opened the boxes to assemble the carriers and found both carriers were broken; one, the body of the carrier was cracked near the carrying handle, the other had a defect in the door assembly that I fixed with a zip tie. Don’t spend your hard earned dollars on this flimsy junk
customer_reviews.author: Gerald A. Hornbeak

customer_reviews.title: LOVE LOVE LOVE THIS PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: LOVE LOVE LOVE THIS PRODUCT!!! I HAD TO MAKE AN EMERGENCY TRIP BACK HOME AND THEY STACKED NICELY IN MY TRUNK. I HAD MY DOGS ON SEAT BELTS THAT ATTACHED TO THEIR HARNESSES. THESE ARE DURABLE, WASHABLE AND LIGHTWEIGHT WITHOUT BEING CHEAP. THEY EVEN HAVE TWO LITTLE AREAS ON TOP FOR TREATS OR SMALL THINGS. I HIGHLY RECOMMEND THESE. I HAVE THE UNDER 10 LBS AND 10-20 LBS
customer_reviews.author: Wendy R

customer_reviews.title: Defeated five times by our 8 mouth old German shepherd. Don't buy!
customer_reviews.text: Works great until our 8 month old German shepherd wanted out and pulled the door in and let herself out 5 times. Other than that it works well. Worst customer service. Emailed company about the kennel. They blamed myself and my dog for the kennel breaking.
customer_reviews.author: van brooks

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble, Easy to clean, Perfect for crate training
customer_reviews.text: True to size. Exactly as we expected. We got this to crate train our puppy. Night 1 was a bit rough as he was in a new home, thousands of miles away from his litter mates. Night 2 was easier. Night 3 he only whined when he needed to go out for a potty break. Shipping was quick and Free with Prime. If we need to upgrade we will buy the same one again in a larger size.
customer_reviews.author: Kat Behm

customer_reviews.title: I have a 70lb boxer and she barely fit inside comfortably. If your dog is any bigger I wouldn't ...
customer_reviews.text: Plastic nuts had to be replaced for metal in order to actually use this to ship my pet, also had to drill holes in the back so it would meet airline guidelines. Could've been sturdier, especially for something claiming to be intended for pets 70-90lbs, it cracked in multiple places during shipping. Also, I have a 70lb boxer and she barely fit inside comfortably. If your dog is any bigger I wouldn't recommend this size.
customer_reviews.author: Temple

customer_reviews.title: Hate these. Wish I bought the Vari Kennel plus
customer_reviews.text: Hate these. Wish I bought the Vari Kennel plus. Bought them for the vaulted doors. One came with a broken door. One was ok. Neither close easily. Both need 2 hands. Amazon has not responded to my comments about the broken doors. I wrote back that the doors are not working properly on both of these crates and I would like to replace them with the pet mate Vari-kennel plus and no one has responded to me yet. This is an inferior product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy, Cheap, DO NOT Trust Your Pet in this Piece of Junk!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I would have given it ZERO stars if I could. I should have known better given the price. Please DO NOT buy this, spend the money on a name brand like Petmate. This barely went together and was so flimsy I would not trust lifting it up with my cat in it. This is the definition of a piece of junk manufactured overseas!!
customer_reviews.author: LJC

customer_reviews.title: Air travel worthy, with minor adjustments.  Overall a good buy.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this kennel for our 50lb dog to travel via airliner. In addition to this kennel, I purchased this kit:  Together, using the metal fasteners in the kit and manually drilling holes in the backside of the kennel so all 4 sides had ventilation, the airline (Alaska) had no issues with the arrangement. The build quality is good, it is bulky but lightweight. I definitely recommend this kennel if air travel is your motivation. Just be prepared to add the ventilation on the backside yourself
customer_reviews.author: Andrew J Montgomery

customer_reviews.title: Wrong color and covered in hair!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this pet carrier to match one that I already have and love. The quality seems the same but the color does NOT match the product photo. This one is more of a gunmetal blue color than grey. Also, the top of the carrier is scratched, as if it was slid on the ground, and it's covered in hair. This has clearly been returned and is not clean. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Ty C.

customer_reviews.title: Got the wrong color
customer_reviews.text: We ordered the light gray 20-25 lbs Aspen dog crate. Received a black bottom and blue top. It appears to be the same crate, but this color wasn't even offered as a choice on Amazon. It's difficult to return these larger items so we're keeping it. Don't really care for the dark colors. Hopefully our puppy will like it. Seems difficult to open and close.
customer_reviews.author: Della Hathaway

customer_reviews.title: Nice Small Crate for Everyday Use
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly for small pets. It is very easy to assemble and great size for home and vehicle use. If carrying a pet that moves around a lot, I would recommend the wingnut fasteners and not just the snap closures, as some of the snap closures alone have come open on mine several times. This doesn't matter to everyone, but I like the unique color too.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Thin plastic poor quality
customer_reviews.text: This is made from very thin plastic, the clips to secure it stays together are poorly matched up. If it didn't come with screws to hold together It would fall apart with your animal in it. Not satisfactory and definitely not safe.
customer_reviews.author: devinemrs

customer_reviews.title: For the price it is decent
customer_reviews.text: I have another carrier to this one that I purchased from a local pet supply store. This one feels much more flimsy and cheaply made in comparison, but the price was about half as well. You get what you pay for. I haven't used this yet, but it will be for a 4lb kitten at this point so I'm sure it will do the job just fine. Assembly was easy enough and packaging was fine. The price point was good enough that I would purchase it again.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan S. Mueller

customer_reviews.title: Door is not safe, opens once locked.
customer_reviews.text: The door did not stay closed and the door fell off way too easily after it was closed and locked again. My cat escaped from inside the carrier. Fortunately, we were still in the house and she was safe. But be careful, your pet can easily escape. I hope mine was just a lone defective carrier.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon customer

customer_reviews.title: Handle came off during first use
customer_reviews.text: I bought the second from the lowest size (up to 15 lbs I think) for my 11 lb cat and the handle came off and carrier (with my cat inside!) hit the floor. Cheap quality, but it seems like that what most people are saying about carriers now so I'm considering rigging a handle myself or returning it.
customer_reviews.author: OSU fan

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality control
customer_reviews.text: Not all of the holes where the screws fit through were drilled. There were very sharp plastic edges in various spots that needed to be sanded down and the door doesn't close smoothly, you have to maneuver and wiggle it into place then close it. Once assembled and sanded down, the crate is as expected. There are very few crates that are this large so, I decided to keep it versus returning it.
customer_reviews.author: critique

customer_reviews.title: Complete junk.
customer_reviews.text: I threw it away today when it broke apart with my 23 lb dog in it, sending him crashing to the ground. This is a cheap piece of crap and on top of it, the gate attach mechanism is even worse. Don't waste your money for any pet over 10 lbs. I wouldn't trust this at all. I just threw it in the trash.
customer_reviews.author: West LA Guy

customer_reviews.title: Not a bad deal
customer_reviews.text: I bought this one because it was a bit cheaper to get it in a slightly damaged box, it was missing one screw (easy fix, I had a spare in a drawer) It did have a small crack on the front but the integrity of the kennel is still intact. It has a couple scratches but again, does not affect the kennel. I think I got a good deal, it's the right size & my dog doesn't care if it's scratched.
customer_reviews.author: B. Widdie

customer_reviews.title: sturdy!
customer_reviews.text: Compared to others listed this one is the best quality for a lower price. Just as listed in ad. Made to very high quality. Item had very good reviews and high rating. *(always check the reviews Before you buy!) Better price than other web-sights, especially in stores. Arrived on time and looks just like ad. Highly recommend this item.
customer_reviews.author: Duke Glock

customer_reviews.title: Spacious, stylish, and easy to assemble.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use/setup. Only drawback was the bottom piece had a large number of plastic “shavings” that were stuck on throughout the molding of the piece. Presumably from the injection-molding process. I had to spend several minutes pulling these off the base, and making sure that none were in the cage—to be eaten by the cat, or on the floor—to be eaten by our toddler! If not for that, I would have rated this item much higher. It was perfectly big enough for our 12 pound kitty to stand up and turn around in.
customer_reviews.author: thepartycrasher

customer_reviews.title: Look around more, pay a little more for the safety of you pet
customer_reviews.text: I'm disappointed, for one, it's not sturdy, thin plastic, maybe to travel in a car, but not in a plane, etc, two, I have a 17lbs Pug, it is way too small for her, I will give them credit for how fast it came, I would return it, if it wasn't 50 miles one way to the nearest UPS store
customer_reviews.author: Puglady

customer_reviews.title: The plastic bags that each carrier was wrapped in was ...
customer_reviews.text: The plastic bags that each carrier was wrapped in was full of moths and moth eggs. The plastic the carriers are made of is so thin and flimsy, it collapses when trying to fasten the retaining clips. I'm not even sure this is a genuine Petmate product, it looks counterfeit.
customer_reviews.author: traderggl

customer_reviews.title: Wrong Size
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the one that has the mini schnauzer pictured and the one I got could barely fit my mini schnauzer, I really felt bad for the dog because he couldnt even stand up in this cage. I was going to use it for him at night because he needs to be locked up due to urinating issues. I had to return this. Other than being to small the carrier looked good quality wise.
customer_reviews.author: Coty Lake

customer_reviews.title: Top right door hole in wrong place.
customer_reviews.text: This was a great kennel. The only problem was the top hole for the right side of the door was not properly located. This allowed my dog to easily push open the door. I didn’t want to return and get a new one so I just drilled a new hole and there has been no problems
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: I have always purchased this brand over the years and I am severely disappointed. The door latches have broken and the crate is only a couple years old. They broke to the point that we cannot fix. I sat on hold with customer service line for over 30 mins to only be disconnected. The automation kept telling me I was first in line then I was second or third then back to first and was never connected. I will try emailing to see if I get a response that way. Would like an replacement door is all :( over all kennel worked well to crate my 2 min pins and chihuahua comfortably.
customer_reviews.author: dentist

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: Works great and comfortably holds my two cats who total about 22 pounds. It is a little challenging carrying the carrier but I can do it. I am a 54-year old woman in good physical condition and can carry the carrier with 22 pounds of animal in one hand. Happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: Finally a crate that our dog loves!!!
customer_reviews.text: This has been an absolute lifesaver for our family, our dog has separation anxiety and has chewed through every other kennel. But for whatever reason he feels like this is his little home/cave and goes in there even when he doesn’t have to, and never chewed it. (And he was chewing through METAL crates previously) definitely would buy again. Also easy to assemble
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay

customer_reviews.title: I am disappointed in the deterioration in the quality
customer_reviews.text: I haven't had to buy a doctor's kennel in several years. I am disappointed in the deterioration in the quality. Especially considering the cost! The plastic seems very thin and soft. It does not seem strong enough to carry a pet in it. The clips do not clip in place, so it's a good thing it came with screws to hold the two halves together. There are a couple of reasons I am keeping it and not returning it. One, the hassle and trouble I have to go through. Two, the box is just to lock my pet up when necessary, and I won't be carrying her around in it.
customer_reviews.author: TXCWright

customer_reviews.title: Ok crate
customer_reviews.text: We recently got a new puppy and of course needed a crate for her. We opted for pink for a girl pup. She's a Boston Terrier and won't get much larger than 15 lbs or so, so this one worked out good. The only thing I didn't like about it is that the plastic material seems thin so I would not recommend storing or setting heavy items on it when you store it away and it's not in use. Other than that it has a nice smoother surface inside that is easy to clean and look forward to use for crate training and road trips.
customer_reviews.author: Zumo

customer_reviews.title: Not very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: My cat needed a new carrier, this is the same one I had previously but a bit bigger. The handles are the same size on both so I pretty much have to wrap my arms around it when I carry it. However, I like that it came with hardware, fast and will work for what I need. UPDATE. My cat weighs 11 lbs and the handle snapped and my baby was injured. I wouldn't purchase this.
customer_reviews.author: Katelyn Kildahl

customer_reviews.title: They easily accommodate up to triplets
customer_reviews.text: I remove the gate and use these carriers in a rather unusual manner - for my goats during kidding season. They work very well! They easily accommodate up to triplets, covering the vents with a heavy towel keeps the kids warm, the kids can come and go as they please to nurse, and I don't have to worry about heat lamps causing a fire. I am very pleased with these carriers, the only reason I gave them a 4 star rating instead of 5 is because mine came with moths. I now have a moderate moth infestation that is not very pleasant. I would suggest unpacking your carriers outside to prevent this problem. Otherwise, the carriers are great!
customer_reviews.author: Barbara MTop Contributor: Coloring

customer_reviews.title: Need door replacement after 20 uses
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble, seems sturdy, except after maybe 20 uses, 1 of the 4 of these that I own had a malfunction with the door (I believe there's a problem with a spring inside it)
customer_reviews.author: Jamie Ann

customer_reviews.title: Item arrived broken
customer_reviews.text: Item arrived with a piece of the plastic top broken. It was not during shipping as the top piece sits inside the bottom of the carrier and the shipping box was undamaged. I didn't have time to try and return it as I need it for my pet immediately and will still function, but hate that I paid for something that was not undamaged.
customer_reviews.author: Don159

customer_reviews.title: Great Design, But My Cat...
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Durable Extra Safety Screws Easily Works with Seat Belts Cons: My cat likes it better than he likes me I don't know what to do. My cat just sits in it, glaring at me. It must be because of it's ultra-safe construction and durable design, and the fact that it easily fits into my car's seat and works well with the seat belt. But ever since we came home from the vet that one day and I left the door open, my cat has just been sitting there staring at me. And staring. And staring. And sta...
customer_reviews.author: Dan S

customer_reviews.title: Very good product for large dogs (59lbs)
customer_reviews.text: My 59 lbs husky loves it. The assembly took less than 10 minutes. It looks smaller when the my dog walked in there at first, but it does have enough high, length and width to allow my dog to circling around comfortably. Because the light weight and moderate size, I took it with me when gardening in the yard, traveling in the SUV, and working in my garage so that my dog could curled inside it comfortably and safely accompany me. I plan to ship my dog in this kennel when traveling afar flying in commercial jets. Will update when such trips are made.
customer_reviews.author: Steven W.

customer_reviews.title: impossible to assemble
customer_reviews.text: impossible to assemble! There is nothing to hold the screw when you are trying to assemble it. The screw has a square block thing on the top that helps you to stable the screw into the hole, but they made it a circle. Totally trash and wasting time.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: So the instructions don't mention the screws that come with ...
customer_reviews.text: So the instructions don't mention the screws that come with the carrier, which are much needed. The clips themselves do not hold the carrier together when you pick it up by the handle and it is empty. The screws make it so it actually stays together. It does have options for zip ties for air lines which would make it really secure. Other than that, it did the job yesterday with my 6 lb cat.
customer_reviews.author: blondolphn

customer_reviews.title: Latches dont work thus rendering this product useless
customer_reviews.text: The top and base come stacked inside each other. When I went to separate them I cut my finger on the sharp plastic. After we were able to get the top and base apart (which took a while) we were then unable to securely latch the top to the base. Unfortunately it's just made out of a very cheap plastic and we will be returnong it. Can't use a cat carrier that you can't securely fasten the top to the base!
customer_reviews.author: Melissa L.

customer_reviews.title: Pleased with this kennel
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this kennel for it's size and price. More so the price than the size. I was very happy to get what I was looking for and it WAS what I was looking for and the old saying "you get what you paid for" I got better. It is a good quality of kennel and I am pleased with it. Highly suggest buying it
customer_reviews.author: MaTaylor67

customer_reviews.title: Easy assembly
customer_reviews.text: This kennel worked perfectly for my puppy for a total of a week and then he outgrew it... that was my mistake on getting a large breed puppy a kennel this size or else I would have loved to keep it. It was everything we needed, good price, EASY assembly, sturdy and handy compartments on top for whatever needed.
customer_reviews.author: Gabby

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: I wish I had listened to the advice others on here have given. This is a cheap, flimsy piece of crap. Mine arrived broken, scratched and scuffed. For $40 this should be an excellent carrier seeing as how you can get one at Wally World for $20 (those are better quality, by the way, just go there). I'll be returning this.
customer_reviews.author: Jenna75

product_meta.title: Aspen Pet Porter Heavy-Duty Pet Kennel
product_meta.description: Size:70-90 LBS| Color:Dark Gray/BlackThe Aspen Pet Porter keeps pet safe and secure for travel and transport while giving pet owners peace of mind. The heavy-duty plastic shell and metal screws provide safety and protection for your pet. The door's durable, easy-open latch allows pet parents to open the kennel conveniently with one hand. Pets can travel comfortably in the kennel with plenty of air and visibility via the ventilation openings. The lightweight design of the travel dog crate allows pet parents to travel with ease. The plastic material of the kennel is easy to clean and wipe down. The Pet Porter's simple metal hardware allows easy assembly. The travel kennel has additional features that are offered depending on size, featuring carrying handles, back vents, compartment covers, and side latches for the smaller sizes and secure, tie-down holes for the larger sizes. The kennel offers nine sizes and 13 different colors. The Aspen Pet Porter meets most airline cargo specifications for easy and safe travel, but pet owners should always check with individual airlines.
feature_bullets: LARGE PET CRATE: This dog kennel for large dogs has an easy-open latch for opening the dog travel carrier with one hand. Suitable for medium dog breeds 70-90 lbs. Measures: 40"

AIR TRAVEL: This pet carrier meets most airline cargo specifications. The air travel kennel for dogs & cats also has ventilation on all sides, a durable comfort-grip handle for comfy, stress-free transport.
KENNELS & HOUSES: Crate & kennel training is vital for dog safety & comfort. We provide traditional travel carriers, wire training & exercise kennels, play pens, barn-style dog houses & more

ASPEN PET: Aspen Pet provides every day essentials for pet parents, dogs & cats. Check out Aspen Pets for leash cable tie-outs, litter box accessories, pet toys, gravity water/food bowls, pet beds, dog houses, carriers & more!

JUST FOR PETS: Petmate makes a variety of pet products for dogs, cats, chickens & other small furry friends! Check out our brands such as Aspen Pet, Arm & Hammer, Booda, Chuckit!, Jackson Galaxy & more!

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
